title: Fee-recipient set in lighthouse VC is not used anymore
body:
**Describe the bug**
My validators on kiln use the nethermind node address as fee recipient instead of the value specified in lighthouse command line arguments.

This behavior changed when updating nethermind from 1.13.2 to 1.13.3 on 18.6.2022. Lighthouse (neither VC nor BN) were not updated at that time and are still on 2.3.1.

Addresses:
- `--suggested-fee-recipient`: https://explorer.kiln.themerge.dev/address/0x0Dc8C6eab56a9568B2C5189a032140a1c5BDf928/validations
- `Node address`: https://explorer.kiln.themerge.dev/address/0xdceebeaf3A915BCd296F29234C03aDb6b3221Ef7/validations

**To Reproduce**
Nethermind:
```
ExecStart=/usr/share/nethermind/Nethermind.Runner --datadir /srv/nethermind/data/

NETHERMIND_CONFIG="kiln"
NETHERMIND_JSONRPCCONFIG_ENABLED=true
NETHERMIND_JSONRPCCONFIG_HOST="0.0.0.0"
NETHERMIND_HEALTHCHECKSCONFIG_ENABLED="true"
NETHERMIND_NETWORKCONFIG_P2PPORT=30310
NETHERMIND_NETWORKCONFIG_DISCOVERYPORT=30310
NETHERMIND_METRICSCONFIG_ENABLED=true
NETHERMIND_METRICSCONFIG_EXPOSEPORT=9090
NETHERMIND_DISCOVERYCONFIG_BUCKETSIZE=12
NETHERMIND_JSONRPCCONFIG_JWTSECRETFILE=/srv/goethereum/jwtsecret
```

Lighthouse BN:
```
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/lighthouse bn \
    --network kiln \
    --datadir /srv/lighthouse \
    --staking \
    --http-allow-sync-stalled \
    --merge \
    --execution-endpoints http://127.0.0.1:8551 \
    --metrics \
    --metrics-address 0.0.0.0 \
    --validator-monitor-auto \
    --jwt-secrets="/srv/goethereum/jwtsecret" \
    --terminal-total-difficulty-override=20000000000000 \
    --boot-nodes="enr:-Iq4QMCTfIMXnow27baRUb35Q8iiFHSIDBJh6hQM5Axohhf4b6Kr_cOCu0htQ5WvVqKvFgY28893DHAg8gnBAXsAVqmGAX53x8JggmlkgnY0gmlwhLKAlv6Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQK6S-Cii_KmfFdUJL2TANL3ksaKUnNXvTCv1tLwXs0QgIN1ZHCCIyk" \
    --port 9002
```

Lighthouse VC:
```
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/lighthouse vc \
    --network kiln \
    --datadir /srv/lighthouse \
    --metrics \
    --suggested-fee-recipient 0x0Dc8C6eab56a9568B2C5189a032140a1c5BDf928
```

**Expected behavior**
Produced blocks use the address specified by the validator instead of the node address.

**Additional context**
Find logs attached (although I don't see anything remarkable there...). I unfortunately do no longer have the logs from when it worked as expected. The logs cover the whole of 11.7.2022. Multiple blocks were produced on that day, one of them (879673) at 18:19:36 (time in logfile).

[logs-wrong-fee-address.zip](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/9094403/logs-wrong-fee-address.zip)
I now also tried to set `NETHERMIND_MERGECONFIG_FEERECIPIENT=0x0Dc8C6eab56a9568B2C5189a032140a1c5BDf928` as a workaround, but this also does not help.

@iSOcH could you verify if this commit helps you? https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/pull/4274 I can create docker or package with sources for you. Btw I removed this settings NETHERMIND_MERGECONFIG_FEERECIPIENT to not confuse users

Thanks. Ran into some issues initially, now waiting until I produce the next block.

Steps I took to build:
- clone the master branch
- build nethermind using `dotnet publish -c Release --sc -r linux-x64 Nethermind.Runner`
- moved `Nethermind.Runner/bin/Release/net6.0/linux-x64` to another place (/home/nethermind/nethermind_built)
- updated my systemd .service file so it points to the binary from that publish output
- missed initially: also copied `plugins` folder from bin/Release/net6.0/plugins (it is not in the publish output)

Yes, looks good. Thanks! For me the issue can be closed, don't know your workflow though.
